alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Clinton, northeastern Essex, northwestern Addison, south central Grand Isle and southwestern Chittenden Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keene, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Essex, Willsboro, Westport, Elizabethtown, Keene, Winooski, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Colchester, Hinesburg, St. George, Starksboro, Shelburne, Ferrisburg, Charlotte, and Keene Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between mile markers 112 and 138. Interstate 89 between mile markers 84 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Lake Champlain, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Western Essex
